floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message: The risk of flooding in the River Axe Area has now reduced. River levels are falling below levels of concern, however there may be standing water seen for several days. Heavy showers are forecast for Monday and river levels will remain sensitive to any further rainfall. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The heavy showers experienced throughout Monday are slowly easing. Further scattered showers are expected on Tuesday. River levels are currently steady or falling in most areas, but remain high and will be sensitive to any further rainfall. Flooding of low lying land and roads close to the river is still possible, but no flooding to properties is currently forecast. Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. We are monitoring river levels and are ready to respond as required. This message will be updated on Tuesday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers in the Forest of Dean
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels are falling, but still pose a flood risk.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.    
Please avoid contact with flood water.

River levels are rising at the Cappenham river gauge as a result of today’s rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads, car parks and farmland is possible. We expect flooding to affect the River Tove from Towcester to Cosgrove, including Silverstone Brook.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours and we expect river levels to remain high. We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 25/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: South East Somerset Rivers, Upper Reaches

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Cam, River Wriggle, Barwick Stream, West Coker Stream

items.message: River levels have risen at the Sherborne Lake river gauge as a result of yesterday’s persistent rainfall.  Consequently, there is a low risk of flooding to low lying land and roads today, Monday, 24/05/21. Areas most vulnerable to flooding are the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. Property flooding is not forecast at this time. Further rainfall is forecast this evening and our incident response staff are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. This message will be updated tomorrow, Tuesday, 25/05/21, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Cae Howel river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from 09:00 24/05.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Predicted peaks:-  Cae Howel 3.5m to 3.7m Monday evening 24/05. No flooding is expected at other gauge locations.
Further light rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated  by 10:00 on 25/05/21, or as the situation changes

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester

floodArea.county: Cheshire West and Chester, Flintshire, Shropshire, Wrexham

items.message: River levels remain high at the Farndon river gauge following heavy rainfall and are expected to rise further following rainfall overnight in Wales. We believe there is a possibility of flooding for low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days, with further showery rain forecast today and tomorrow 25/05/21. Please be aware that access to Townfield Lane could be cut off due to high river levels. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring weather forecasts and river levels, and will issue Flood Warnings if necessary. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, be aware of your surroundings and keep up to date with the current situation. This message will be updated tomorrow, Tuesday 25th May, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high but are beginning to fall at the Brokenborough river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall over the weekend.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible until Wednesday 26/05/2021.  We expect flooding to affect the road at Reybridge.   Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.
Further light showery rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  River levels are falling, but still pose a flood risk.
We are closely monitoring the situation.   Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures and stay aware in case further warnings are issued.  
This message will be updated by 10:00 on Tuesday, 25/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking the condition of defences.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Pillings Lock river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible later this evening, 24/05/21.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road.  Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high tomorrow, 25/05/21.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 25/05/21, or as the situation changes.

items.message: The flood alert for the Upper Derwent has been removed as levels continue to fall. Further showers are expected over the next few days but these should be lighter than those seen over the weekend and are not currently expected to require re-issue of this alert.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.    
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We continue to monitor the situation.

floodArea.county: Shropshire, Staffordshire, Telford and Wrekin, Wrexham

items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Tern - Walcot river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from overnight Monday, 24/05.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem and Rodington.   
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are checking defences.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated  by 10:00 on 25/05/2021, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, North Somerset, Somerset
floodArea.riverOrSea: River Chew, Chew Stoke Stream, Winford Brook

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels are falling.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.  Further light showery rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.

Property flooding is not currently expected.

River levels have risen on the River Thame and Chalgrove Brook as a result of rainfall yesterday. Flooding of low lying land, footpaths and roads closest to the River Thame in Thame, Stadhampton and Dorchester areas is possible.

The river is expected to continue rising very slowly today. Our staff are monitoring the situation closely. The weather forecast is for mainly dry weather today and tomorrow. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings.
 
This message will be updated this evening, (25/05/2021), or if the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, Wiltshire

items.message:
River levels are rising at the Bradford on Avon river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall on Friday and Sunday.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible until Wednesday, 26/05/2021.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed.   Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.
Tuesday is mainly dry and we expect river levels to begin falling on Tuesday evening, 25/05/2021.
We are closely monitoring the situation.   Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures and stay aware in case further warnings are issued.  
This message will be updated by 18:00 on Tuesday, 25/05/2021, or as the situation changes.
